IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: TO SUPPORT RESOURCES LEGACY FUND TO HELP DONORS ENGAGE IN STRATEGIC CONSERVATION ENDEAVORS.
IRS990.MissionDesc: RLFF, AS A SUPPORTING ORGANIZATION OF RESOURCES LEGACY FUND (RLF), IS A SEPARATE 501(C)(3) NONPROFIT ORGANIZATION THAT SUPPORTS, PERFORMS ESSENTIAL SERVICES FOR, AND OPERATES FOR THE BENEFIT OF RLF. RLFF SUPPORTS RLF TO HELP DONORS ENGAGE IN CONSERVATION ENDEAVORS IN CALIFORNIA THAT HAVE LASTING VALUE.
IRS990.Desc: DURING THE LAST YEAR, RESOURCES LEGACY FUND FOUNDATION (RLFF) CARRIED OUT PROGRAMS AND AWARDED GRANTS TO SUPPORT ACTIVITIES THAT SOUGHT TO IMPROVE ENVIRONMENTAL SUSTAINABILITY IN CALIFORNIA, INCLUDING THE OCEAN OFF CALIFORNIA'S COAST. RLFF ACCOMPLISHMENTS DURING 2015 INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING:RLFF CONTINUED TO PROVIDE SUPPORT TO A BROAD RANGE OF ORGANIZATIONS TO ADVANCE EFFECTIVE IMPLEMENTATION OF CALIFORNIA'S MARINE PROTECTED AREA (MPA) NETWORK, IMPROVE OCEAN GOVERNANCE, AND SECURE PUBLIC FUNDING FOR OCEAN CONSERVATION. RLFF GRANTEES PERFORMED SCIENTIFIC AND HUMAN USE MONITORING OF CALIFORNIA'S NEWLY ESTABLISHED NETWORK OF MPAS. RLFF ALSO SUPPORTED DEVELOPMENT OF BASELINE AND ONGOING MPA MONITORING PLANS AS WELL AS COORDINATION BETWEEN STATE AGENCIES AND OTHERS TO ADVANCE EFFICIENT MONITORING PROGRAMS. RLFF GRANTEES ENGAGED IN A NUMBER OF MPA-RELATED OUTREACH AND EDUCATION EFFORTS INCLUDING INITIATION AND SUPPORT OF LOCAL COALITIONS MADE UP OF COMMUNITY GROUPS, MUNICIPAL, COUNTY, AND STATE AGENCIES, FOCUSED ON EFFECTIVE MPA MANAGEMENT.

SupportedOrganizationName.BusinessNameLine1Txt: CONSERVATION ORGS IN CA (SEE SCH I)

Form990ScheduleAPartVIGrp.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: SCHEDULE A PART IV SECTION A LINE 1:
Form990ScheduleAPartVIGrp.ExplanationTxt: IN ADDITION TO THE RESOURCES LEGACY FUND ("RLF"), THE RESOURCES LEGACY FUND FOUNDATION (THE "FOUNDATION") ALSO SUPPORTS NON-DESIGNATED PUBLICLY SUPPORTED ORGANIZATIONS. THE FOUNDATION'S ARTICLES OF INCORPORATION, WHICH WERE SUBMITTED TO THE IRS AS PART OF RLFF'S EXEMPTION APPLICATION, PROPERLY SPECIFYING THE PUBLICLY SUPPORTED ORGANIZATION ON WHOSE BEHALF IT OPERATES. THE ARTICLES OF INCORPORATION PROVIDE THAT THE FOUNDATION IS FORMED "TO SUPPORT, PERFORM ESSENTIAL SERVICES FOR, AND AT ALL TIMES HEREAFTER TO OPERATE EXCLUSIVELY FOR THE BENEFIT OF RESOURCES LEGACY FUND AND OTHER ORGANIZATIONS DESCRIBED IN SECTION 509(A)(1) OR SECTION 509(A)(2) OF THE INTERNAL REVENUE CODE THAT PROMOTE LAND CONSERVATION AND ENVIRONMENTAL PROTECTION IN CALIFORNIA," AMONG OTHER PURPOSES. SPECIFICATION BY CLASS, RATHER THAN BY NAME, IS APPROPRIATE BECAUSE THE FOUNDATION IS CONTROLLED BY RLF, A PUBLIC CHARITY. SEE TREAS. REG. SECTION 1.509(A)-4(D)(2). THE CLASS SPECIFIED CONTAINS ONLY ORGANIZATIONS WHOSE PURPOSES ARE SUBSUMED WITHIN RLF'S LAND CONSERVATION AND ENVIRONMENTAL PROTECTION PURPOSES AS SET FORTH IN THE ARTICLE II.B. OF RLF'S ARTICLES OF INCORPORATION.

OF WEST MARIN 23-7115368 ENVIRONMENT CALIFORNIA 68-0531882 HSU SPONSORED PROGRAMS FOUNDATION 94-6050071 LIGHTHAWK 84-0852104 LOS ANGELES WATERKEEPER 95-4444787 MUSEUM FDN OF PACIFIC GROVE 32-0268455 NATURAL RESOURCES DEFENSE COUNCIL - SF 13-2654926 NATURE CONSERVANCY - SF 53-0242652 NORTHCOAST ENVIRONMENTAL CTR 23-7122386 ONEOC 95-2021700 ORANGE COUNTY COASTKEEPER 33-0847892 OTTER PROJECT 77-0490102 REGENTS OF UC SANTA CRUZ 94-1539563 SANTA CATALINA ISLAND CONSERVANCY 23-7228407 SAVE OUR SHORES 94-2745941 STEWARDS OF THE COAST AND REDWOODS 94-3039895 SURFRIDER FOUNDATION 95-3941826 TIDES CENTER 94-3213100 WISHTOYO FOUNDATION 95-4124859 SUPPORTED ORGANIZATIONS REMOVED: NAME EIN COUNTY OF SAN MATEO 94-9600532 EARTH ISLAND INSTITUTE 94-2889684 GRAY WHALES COUNT 33-1185653 HEAL THE BAY 95-4031055 MARINE APPLIED RESEARCH & EXPL 31-1821639 SANTA BARBARA MUSEUM NAT HIST 95-1643378 THE SPORTFISHING CONSERVANCY 20-8948522 (II) REASON FOR SUCH ACTIONS: RLFF EVALUATES AN ORGANIZATION ON A PROJECT BY PROJECT BASIS AND LOOKS AT EACH ORGANIZATION BEFORE PROVIDING A GRANT TO ENSURE THAT THE ORGANIZATION MEETS RLFF'S REQUIREMENTS. PROJECTS CHANGE EACH YEAR, RESULTING IN ADDITIONS AND DELETIONS. (III) AUTHORITY & (IV) HOW THE ACTION WAS ACCOMPLISHED: NO CHANGE TO THE GOVERNING DOCUMENTS WAS REQUIRED, AS THE ORGANIZATIONS THAT RECEIVED GRANTS ARE WITHIN THE CLASS OF ORGANIZATIONS AUTHORIZED TO RECEIVE SUPPORT FROM RLFF.

Form990ScheduleAPartVIGrp.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: SCHEDULE A PART IV SECTION B LINE 2:
Form990ScheduleAPartVIGrp.ExplanationTxt: THE FOUNDATION IS AUTHORIZED IN ITS ARTICLES OF INCORPORATION TO PROVIDE SUPPORT TO A CLASS OF ORGANIZATIONS THAT CONSISTS OF OTHER ORGANIZATIONS DESCRIBED IN SECTION 509(A)(1) OR SECTION 509(A)(2) OF THE INTERNAL REVENUE CODE THAT PROMOTE LAND CONSERVATION AND ENVIRONMENTAL PROTECTION IN CALIFORNIA. BY PROVIDING GRANTS TO THESE ORGANIZATIONS, RLFF IS FURTHERING THE SUPPORTED ORGANIZATION'S (RLF) PURPOSE, WHICH IS TO HELP DONORS ENSURE THE PROTECTION AND STEWARDSHIP OF RESILIENT AND VIBRANT NATURAL SYSTEMS THAT SUPPORT HEALTHY COMMUNITIES AND ECONOMIC VITALITY.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: RLFF HAS APPLIED THE ACCOUNTING PRINCIPLES RELATED TO ACCOUNTING FOR UNCERTAINTY IN INCOME TAXES AND HAS DETERMINED THAT THERE IS NO MATERIAL IMPACT ON THE FINANCIAL STATEMENTS. WITH SOME EXCEPTIONS, RLFF IS NO LONGER SUBJECT TO U.S. FEDERAL OR STATE INCOME TAX EXAMINATIONS BY TAX AUTHORITIES FOR YEARS PRIOR TO 2011.

RecipientBusinessName.BusinessNameLine1Txt: COASTAL ECOSYSTEMS INSTITUTE OF NORTHERN CALIFORNIA
ENV ACT COM OF WEST MARIN
STEWARDS OF THE COAST AND REDWOODS

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: ALL RLFF GRANTS INCLUDE REQUIREMENTS FOR PERIODIC REPORTS RECONCILING GRANT ACTIVITIES, PROGRESS, AND OUTCOMES WITH GRANT OBJECTIVES, AS WELL AS A RECONCILIATION OF GRANT EXPENDITURES WITH THE PROPOSAL BUDGET. IN ADDITION, STAFF MAINTAINS CONTACT WITH GRANTEES AND PERIODICALLY CONDUCTS FIELD VISITS FOR SIGNIFICANT PROJECTS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 2
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: MICHAEL MANTELL, MARY SCOONOVER, AND SHAUNA MANNER ARE OFFICERS OF RLF AND HAVE A BUSINESS RELATIONSHIP - MICHAEL AND MARY ARE OWNERS OF RESOURCES LAW GROUP (RLG) AND SHAUNA IS EMPLOYED BY RLG.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 4
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION MADE THE FOLLOWING CHANGES TO ITS BYLAWS: - INCREASED THE MAXIMUM NUMBER OF DIRECTORS FROM 11 TO 15 - CHANGED THE QUORUM REQUIREMENT FROM 1/5 TO 1/3 OF THE AUTHORIZED NUMBER OF DIRECTORS OR 2 DIRECTORS, WHICHEVER IS LARGER - EXTENDED THE COMPENSATION DETERMINATION REQUIREMENT TO THE CFO.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE 990 IS PREPARED BY OUTSIDE TAX ACCOUNTANTS, REVIEWED BY THE CONTROLLER, CHIEF FINANCIAL OFFICER, THE PRESIDENT OF RESOURCES LEGACY FUND FOUNDATION, AND THE AUDIT COMMITTEE. IT IS THEN SENT TO ALL VOTING MEMBERS BEFORE FILING.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: A CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY COVERS OFFICERS AND DIRECTORS, WHO ARE REQUIRED TO DISCLOSE POTENTIAL CONFLICTS ANNUALLY IN WRITING. THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS DETERMINES IF AN ACTUAL CONFLICT EXISTS AND IS RESPONSIBLE FOR ANY REQUIRED REVIEW AND ACTION. ADDITIONALLY, A CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY IS INCLUDED IN THE EMPLOYEE POLICY MANUAL. UPON HIRE, EMPLOYEES ARE REQUIRED TO READ IT AND ACKNOWLEDGE THAT THEY ARE FAMILIAR WITH AND WILL OBSERVE THE POLICY.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 15
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE GOVERNANCE COMMITTEE, ON BEHALF OF THE BOARD, ENGAGED AN OUTSIDE CONSULTANT TO REVIEW THE EXECUTIVE COMPENSATION OF RLF'S PEERS, TO ASSESS RLF'S EXECUTIVE COMPENSATION, AND TO PROVIDE AN INDEPENDENT OPINION REGARDING THE REASONABLENESS OF RLF'S EXECUTIVE COMPENSATION. THE POSITIONS OF PRESIDENT, EXECUTIVE VICE PRESIDENT, AND CHIEF FINANCIAL OFFICER WERE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSESSMENT. THIS PROCESS WAS LAST UNDERTAKEN IN 2015. ON A BI-ANNUAL BASIS, THE PRESIDENT REVIEWS COMPENSATION SURVEY DATA AND COMPENSATION DATA FROM SEVERAL SIMILAR ORGANIZATIONS, COMBINES IT WITH HIS AWARENESS OF COMPENSATION PRACTICES GAINED THROUGH HIS PROFESSIONAL AND VOLUNTEER AFFILIATIONS, AND ESTABLISHES A REASONABLE COMPENSATION LEVEL FOR THE KEY EMPLOYEES. THIS PROCESS WAS LAST UNDERTAKEN IN 2015.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: AUDITED STATEMENTS AND 990 TAX RETURNS ARE AVAILABLE AND DOWNLOADABLE FROM WWW.RESOURCESLEGACYFUND.ORG. ORGANIZATIONAL BY-LAWS AND IRS LETTER OF DETERMINATION OF TAX EXEMPTION ARE PROVIDED AT REQUEST TO ALL DONORS.
CONSULTING FEES: PROGRAM SERVICE EXPENSES 429,265. MANAGEMENT AND GENERAL EXPENSES 0. FUNDRAISING EXPENSES 0. TOTAL EXPENSES 429,265.

FEES INCLUDE PAYMENTS TO OVER 10 VENDORS FOR SCIENTIFIC STUDIES, STRATEGIC COMMUNICATIONS, MAPPING, CONSERVATION EXPERTISE, PROGRAM DESIGN, MANAGEMENT AND EVALUATION, PREPARATION OF ENVIRONMENTAL DOCUMENTS REQUIRED FOR PROJECTS BY GOVERNMENTAL AGENCIES, AND POLICY RESEARCH AND ANALYSIS.
NEITHER PROCESS HAS CHANGED FROM THE PRIOR YEAR.
